org.apache.nlpcraft.client

Interface NCClient


  • public interface NCClient
    Java client API. Java REST client provides native and easy-to-use wrapper for NLPCraft REST APIs for any JVM-based languages like Java, Scala, Kotlin or Groovy. Note that NLPCraft REST APIs allow to submit the request to existing deployed data model and perform other related, auxiliary operations. To create data models you need to use main NLPCraft APIs.

    External User ID
    Several methods on Java client accept external "on-behalf-of" user ID (usrExtId) additionally to the regular user ID (usrID). In these methods zero, one or both IDs should be provided. If none are provided the ID of the currently signed in user will be used, and if both are provided they should point to the same user. External user ID allows to use user identification from the external systems without a need to import all the existing users into NLPCraft in the first place.

    Typical usage pattern for integrating NLPCraft into existing system is to create a single administrative NLPCraft user, sign in with that account and then use external "on-behalf-of" user IDs in all the requests. This way you get the same functionality as if using ordinary user IDs but without a need to migrate and synchronize all user accounts from the existing system to NLPCraft.

    Usage
    Java client usage is straightforward - create client instance using NCClientBuilder and use this instance for all API calls: 

         // Get client instance with all defaults.
     NCClient cli = new NCClientBuilder().build();

     // Perform any necessary calls...
     NCResult res = cli.askSync("my.model.id", txt);

     // Close client & sign out at the end.
     cli.close();
    See Also:
    NCClientBuilder

      • clearConversation

        void clearConversation(String mdlId,
                       Long usrId,
                       String usrExtId)
                throws NCClientException,
                       IOException
        Clears conversation context for the given model and the specified user.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        mdlId - Model ID.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.
        See Also:
        clearDialog(String, Long, String)

        void clearDialog(String mdlId,
                 Long usrId,
                 String usrExtId)
          throws NCClientException,
                 IOException
        Clears the dialog flow for the given model ID and specified user.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        mdlId - Model ID.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Throws:

        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.
        See Also:

      • addFeedback

        long addFeedback(String srvReqId,
                 double score,
                 String comment,
                 Long usrId,
                 String usrExtId)
          throws NCClientException,
                 IOException
        Adds feedback for given request.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        srvReqId - ID of the request to add feedback for.
        score - Feedback score, between 0 and 1 inclusive. Higher score indicates better result.
        comment - Optional feedback comment.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Returns:
        ID of the newly added feedback record.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • deleteFeedback

        void deleteFeedback(Long id)
             throws NCClientException,
                    IOException
        Deletes feedback record.
        Parameters:
        id - Optional ID of the feedback record to delete. if - all feedback records for the current user will be deleted.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • getAllFeedback

        List<NCFeedback> getAllFeedback(String srvReqId,
                                Long usrId,
                                String usrExtId)
                         throws NCClientException,
                                IOException
        Gets all feedback records for given request ID and user. If request ID is not provided all feedback records for the specified user will be returned.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        srvReqId - Optional request ID.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Returns:
        List of feedback records.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • addUser

        long addUser(String email,
             String passwd,
             String firstName,
             String lastName,
             String avatarUrl,
             boolean isAdmin,
             Map<String,String> properties,
             String extId)
      throws NCClientException,
             IOException
        Adds new user to the company of the currently signed in user. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges.

        User IDs
        This method accepts optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID. If this ID is provided than this method will update the existing user record located by that ID instead of creating a new user record.

        Parameters:
        email - New user email.
        passwd - New user password. Note that NLPCraft doesn't store passwords and therefore cannot retrieve them later.
        firstName - New user first name.
        lastName - New user last name.
        avatarUrl - Optional new user avatar URL. Can be null.
        isAdmin - Whether or not the new user will have administrative privileges.
        properties - Map of additional user-defined user properties.
        extId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID. Can be null.
        Returns:
        ID of the newly created user.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • updateUser

        void updateUser(long id,
                String firstName,
                String lastName,
                String avatarUrl,
                Map<String,String> properties)
         throws NCClientException,
                IOException
        Updates given user. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges.
        Parameters:
        id - User ID.
        firstName - Mandatory user first name.
        lastName - Mandatory user last name.
        avatarUrl - Optional user avatar URL. Can be null.
        properties - Optional user properties. Can be null or empty.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • resetUserPassword

        void resetUserPassword(Long id,
                       String newPasswd)
                throws NCClientException,
                       IOException
        Resets password for the given user. Note that NLPCraft doesn't store clear text passwords and therefore passwords cannot be retrieved - they can only be reset. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the user for which to reset the password.
        newPasswd - New password.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • updateUserAdmin

        void updateUserAdmin(Long id,
                     boolean isAdmin)
              throws NCClientException,
                     IOException
        Grants or denies given user administrative privileges. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the user for which to change administrative privileges.
        isAdmin - Administrative privileges flag.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • deleteUser

        void deleteUser(Long usrId,
                String usrExtId)
         throws NCClientException,
                IOException
        Deletes given user. Note that you cannot delete the last admin in the company. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • getUser

        NCUser getUser(Long usrId,
               String usrExtId)
        throws NCClientException,
               IOException
        Gets user record. Note that only users with administrative privileges can get user records for other users in the company.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Returns:
        User record.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

        Returns:
        List of user records.

        List<NCProbe> getProbes()
                 throws NCClientException,
                        IOException
        Gets all active (connected to the REST server) probes for the current signed in user company. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges.
        Returns:

        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • ask

        String ask(String mdlId,
           String txt,
           String data,
           boolean enableLog,
           Long usrId,
           String usrExtId)
    throws NCClientException,
           IOException
        Submits request for asynchronous processing. This method will return immediately and you have to use check(Set, Integer, Long, String) method to check its result.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        mdlId - ID of the model to submit the request to.
        txt - Text to process.
        data - Optional JSON data payload.
        enableLog - Whether or not to enable processing log collection.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Returns:
        Server request ID of the submitted request.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.
        See Also:
        askSync(String, String, String, boolean, Long, String), askSync(String, String), ask(String, String)

      • ask

        default String ask(String mdlId,
                   String txt)
            throws NCClientException,
                   IOException
        Submits request for asynchronous processing. This is a shortcut call that is equivalent to: 
             ask(mdlId, txt, null, false, null, null);
        Parameters:
        mdlId - ID of the model to submit the request to.
        txt - Text to process.
        Returns:
        Server request ID of the submitted request.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • askSync

        NCResult askSync(String mdlId,
                 String txt,
                 String data,
                 boolean enableLog,
                 Long usrId,
                 String usrExtId)
          throws NCClientException,
                 IOException
        Submits request for synchronous processing. This method will block and return only when result is available or internal time out expired.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        mdlId - ID of the model to submit the request to.
        txt - Text to process.
        data - Optional JSON data payload.
        enableLog - Whether or not to enable processing log collection.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Returns:
        Query processing result.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.
        See Also:
        askSync(String, String), ask(String, String), ask(String, String, String, boolean, Long, String)

      • askSync

        default NCResult askSync(String mdlId,
                         String txt)
                  throws NCClientException,
                         IOException
        Submits request for synchronous processing. This is a shortcut call that is equivalent to: 
             askSync(mdlId, txt, null, false, null, null);
        Parameters:
        mdlId - ID of the model to submit the request to.
        txt - Text to process.
        Returns:
        Query processing result.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • check

        List<NCResult> check(Set<String> srvReqIds,
                     Integer maxRows,
                     Long usrId,
                     String usrExtId)
              throws NCClientException,
                     IOException
        Gets the status and result (OK or failure) of the previously submitted requests. Request statuses returned sorted by their registration time, starting from newest.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        srvReqIds - Optional server request IDs for which to get the statuses. If not provided - statuses for all currently processed requests for the specified user will be returned. Invalid or unknown server request IDs will be ignored.
        maxRows - Optional maximum number of returned items - by default all statuses will be returned. Can be null.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Returns:
        List of results.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • cancel

        void cancel(Set<String> srvReqIds,
            Long usrId,
            String usrExtId)
     throws NCClientException,
            IOException
        Cancels the previously submitted sentence and removes its result, if any, from the server storage. Must be called when query result is no longer needed (i.e. downloaded by all client apps) to release the server memory. Note that query results will auto-expire on server after a certain period of time. Note also that even when the embedded probe is used the results are still stored on the server and have to be cancelled or otherwise will be timed out.

        User IDs
        This method allows multiple ways of specifying the ID of the user. If neither usrId or usrExtId are provided (both are null) then the currently signed in user ID of this client instance will be used by default. If both user IDs are provided they must identify the same user in NLPCraft. If only external "on-behalf-of" usrExtId parameter is provided and such user doesn't yet exist in NLPCraft - it will be automatically created. Note that only admin users can specify user ID other than their own (as either usrId or usrExtId).

        Parameters:
        srvReqIds - Server IDs of the requests to cancel. Optional, all current user requests will be cancelled by default. Invalid or unknown server request IDs will be ignored.
        usrId - Optional user ID.
        usrExtId - Optional external "on-behalf-of" user ID.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • addCompany

        NCNewCompany addCompany(String name,
                        String website,
                        String country,
                        String region,
                        String city,
                        String address,
                        String postalCode,
                        String adminEmail,
                        String adminPasswd,
                        String adminFirstName,
                        String adminLastName,
                        String adminAvatarUrl)
                 throws NCClientException,
                        IOException
        Adds new company with given parameters. Administrative privileges required. Note that to create a new company you also need to supply information for its first administrative user account which will be created in the same time.
        Parameters:
        name - Company name.
        website - Optional company website.
        country - Optional company address country.
        region - Optional company address region.
        city - Optional company address city.
        address - Optional company address.
        postalCode - Optional company address postal code.
        adminEmail - Company administrator email.
        adminPasswd - Company administrator password.
        adminFirstName - Optional company administrator first name.
        adminLastName - Optional company administrator last name.
        adminAvatarUrl - Optional company administrator avatar URL.
        Returns:
        New company data.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • getCompany

        NCCompany getCompany()
              throws NCClientException,
                     IOException
        Gets the company descriptor for the current signed in user.
        Returns:
        Company descriptor.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • updateCompany

        void updateCompany(String name,
                   String website,
                   String country,
                   String region,
                   String city,
                   String address,
                   String postalCode)
            throws NCClientException,
                   IOException
        Updates company information for the current signed in user. Current signed in user must have administrative privileges. Note that users cannot update or get information about other companies.
        Parameters:
        name - Company name.
        website - Optional company website.
        country - Optional company address country.
        region - Optional company address region.
        city - Optional company address city.
        address - Optional company address.
        postalCode - Optional company address postal code.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • resetCompanyToken

        String resetCompanyToken()
                  throws NCClientException,
                         IOException
        Sets and returns new company probe authentication token. Administrative privileges required for resetting company token.
        Returns:
        New company probe token.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • deleteCompany

        void deleteCompany()
            throws NCClientException,
                   IOException
        Deletes company and all its users and other associated data. Administrative privileges required.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.

      • close

        void close()
    throws NCClientException,
           IOException
        Closes the client and signs out from the REST server. Any further calls to this client will result in exception.
        Throws:
        NCClientException - Thrown in case of client-specific errors.
        IOException - Thrown in case of generic I/O errors.
